TopicTitle: Feature request: Canyon system near KSC

Articles.Content: I'd like to request than a canyon system be added near Kerbal Space Center so that I have somewhere awesome to test the handling and/or impact tolerance of all the aircraft I build. Flying through an extensive canyon system would be super cool... maybe the canyon bed could also have a lot of sweet jumps for rover testing.

> 
> I'd like to request than a canyon system be added near Kerbal Space Center so that I have somewhere awesome to test the handling and/or impact tolerance of all the aircraft I build. Flying through an extensive canyon system would be super cool... maybe the canyon bed could also have a lot of sweet jumps for rover testing.

Try to start a thread like this in a Sugestions and development discussion next time. IMHO Squad for now won't change the terrain on Kerbin as they are adressing some old bugs and issues. However, you can test your vehicle over the curvy river on the western side of the continent that is west to KSC.. Problem is that you have to fly 1000 or more km to it.

Thanks [kerbalmaps.com](http://www.kerbalmaps.com) for the original map.

And I thought I was the only one!

I'd love to have a nearby canyon to try flying through--right now all we've got for glider excitement is trying yet again to zoom through the arch in the Science Facility. It'd be great practice for off-world flight missions; for instance, when Bill tells Jeb he's crazy for volunteering to pilot a flight through the Great Rift on Dres, Jeb can say "It'll be just like bulls-eyeing womp rats in Kerman's Canyon back home."
The answer to this is: multiple launch sites scattered around the whole planet.
